content.description: There are a few distinct cruxes on this one with mellow climbing in between.  This climb is very featured with awesome edges, slots, flakes, and even some polished slab thrown in for good measure.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the Checkerboard.  It ascends a water streak through many different features.  The easiest way to find this one is to look for a bolted lined that starts in opposing cracks right off the ground.  Queen of Kings is the route to the right of this marker.

content.description: This is a mostly gear-protected route on the left side of the Checkerboard wall.  While the climbing is relatively easy, the gear at the crux seemed pretty dicey to me, and the rock quality is not great in places (a common theme at Chessmen). I suppose you could always bail onto Queen of Kings if you get spooked, but I don't recommend for novice trad leaders.  I'm giving it PG13 because if the gear blew at the crux you'd have a really bad day.
content.protection: One bolt at start, then your standard Lemmon rack should do just fine.  Keep a #1 Camalot for a flaring pod at the crux (you might be able to get creative with small nuts).
content.location: Just to the left of the fully bolted "Checkered Bored" (5.9) is a single bolt.  This is the start of Checkered Past.  It follows shallow cracks up to a left-facing corner.

content.description: Starts on a tricky face with a surprisingly high first bolt. Be careful here as getting to the bolt is not easy; in fact getting to it and past it may be the crux. After clipping a second bolt, follow a seam up through a roof (also cruxy) then delicately climb the water-polished crack and face to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts, light rack to #2 Camalot. Small gear required. A bomber yellow Master Cam/.3 Camalot protects the roof move.
content.location: See Squeezing the Lemmon 3 for this route's exact location.

content.description: This route starts off pretty pedestrian, but ends with some neat stemming and mantling up a wide chute-like feature.
content.location: The rightmost fully bolted line on the Checkerboard that is sandwiched between two mixed lines.

content.description: start route by clipping a bolt on the face, clip another bolt moving toward left facing corner beneath a roof, pass the roof and follow broken crack to chains  tho its a chill grade be prepare for some lemmon trickery
content.protection: draws for the 2 botls, small medium wires, rack small stuff and a 2 for the roof
content.location: farthest right on checkerboard  left facing corner beneath a roof

content.description:
Five sport and mixed routes ranging from 5.8 to 5.10. 

  The Checkerboard sector is shaded until approximately 2pm.
